subject: Relationships
title: Microexpressions: The Leaks You Can't Hide
description: A quick win: understand Microexpressions: The Leaks You Can't Hide.

hook.text: A flash of disgust crosses your partner's face in a fifth of a second. You didn't catch it. Your brain did.

buildup.text: Microexpressions are involuntary facial movements lasting less than 0.5 seconds. They reveal true emotions.

discovery.text: Paul Ekman identified seven universal microexpressions: anger, contempt, disgust, fear, joy, sadness, surprise.

twist.text: Most people can't consciously read microexpressions. But emotionally attuned partners detect them intuitively.

climax.text: Your face betrays you 50 times a day. In relationships, these micro-leaks shape trust more than words do.

punchline.text: Your face tells the truth in a fifth of a second.

quiz.question: How long do microexpressions typically last?
